metadata.Title: CVE-2022-24883 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
FreeRDP is a free implementation of the Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP). Prior to version 2.7.0, server side authentication against a `SAM` file might be successful for invalid credentials if the server has configured an invalid `SAM` file path. FreeRDP based clients are not affected. RDP server implementations using FreeRDP to authenticate against a `SAM` file are affected. Version 2.7.0 contains a fix for this issue. As a workaround, use custom authentication via `HashCallback` and/or ensure the `SAM` database path configured is valid and the application has file handles left.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-24883` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

freerdp2-shadow-x11 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
freerdp2-wayland - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
freerdp2-x11 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
libfreerdp-client2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
libfreerdp-server2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
libfreerdp-shadow-subsystem2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
libfreerdp-shadow2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
libfreerdp2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
libuwac0-0 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
libwinpr-tools2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
libwinpr2-2 - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
winpr-utils - 2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: freerdp: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
freerdp2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.0+dfsg1-0ubuntu0.18.04.3').
